page.title: 12ST. JOHN'S CHURCH, CLAY HILL
page.content: St. John's the Baptist Church was completed in 1857 in the venetian style, as a Chapel of Ease to St. Andrews, Enfield Parish Church.The church was consecrated and finally became a separate parish in 1867.Later a vicarage was built and then chairs removed from the church and benches installed.Gas lighting replaced the original oil lamps and electric light- ing was installed in 1949.The altar reredos of terracotta sandtone showing the baptism of Christ dates from this time, as does the Hunter Organ.The brass eagle lantern was presented in 1896.The carillon peal of 8 bells was installed in 1927 as a memorial to those who died in 1914-18 war.The Church has many stained glass windows, many dating from the early years and for this reason the Church is now a listed building.
